ygData.messageBody:
>With Lute (why sing it without?) it's 4hp +2 for every 6 levels of exp. So
>at 6th level it's doing 6 hp per pulse and 12th level it's 8 hp per pulse
>(sitting). The weird part is that at 24th level I started doing 13 hp per
>pulse and 11 sitting down (the difference used to be just one between
>sitting and standing) so I that seems to blow the formula but that's the
one
>I always heard.

I often sing it while smacking away in combat.
You are confused a bit mixing in the natural regen rate here. At 12 you get
8 pts per pulse with lute while sitting total. That's 6 from Hymn plus 2
natural. At 18th you get 10 per pulse sitting total, again 8 from Hymn plus
2 natural. Your sitting regen rates increases past 2 after 20th level, not
sure exactly when but I know it goes up to 3 natural regen somewhere soon on
or after 20th.
Using my formula for lute of (1hp + 1hp/6lvls)*2 means at 12 hymn should do
6, it does; at 18th it should do 8, again it does. It does half that much
without lute so you get at 12th level Hymn for 3, plus 1 natural so 4. At
18 it would be 4 plus 1 natural so 5. These both fit the actual result so
the equation is correct.

>More simply put, Hymn starts at 6 per pulse at 6th level (but you'd get two
>from just sitting without the song) and it improves 2 hp per pulse every
six
>levels after. This is not dependent on string skill level because I hear
it
>keeps going up even after we've maxed string.

Same as you get with my equation, Hymn does 4pt at 6th, plus the 2 for
sitting = 6.


Kitasi of E'ci
